threat: A physically local attacker that could insert mountable devices could exploit this to crash the system or possibly gain root privileges.
A local attacker could exploit this to consume CPU resources, leading to a denial of service.
If a system was using Bluetooth, a remote attacker could send specially crafted traffic to crash the system or gain root privileges.
A remote attacker could exploit this to exhaust network resources, leading to a denial of service.
A local attacker could exploit this with a malformed Be filesystem and crash the system, leading to a denial of service.
A remote attacker with a malicious server could exploit this to crash the system or possibly execute arbitrary code as the root user.
